title: Information Disclosure when /invitations/<token>.json is not yet accepted

profile.name: HackerOne
profile.about: Vulnerability disclosure should be safe, transparent, and rewarding.

vulnerability_information:
Hi Team,

**Summary:**

First, i just want to clarify that this finding seems a purely human mistake from one of the hackerone member team who created a summary of this report: #283309

---

I have found that you guys (HackerOne) was disclosing email address and private program as part of this report summary of previously disclosed report: https://hackerone.com/reports/283309

__Summary screenshot below:__

███████

You will observed that HackerOne team create a summary of the report, but the summary discloses the token of the report PoC of the researcher: https://hackerone.com/invitations/█████████.json , but since the token is still valid (means invitation note yet accepted) it discloses the email address of the researcher and the private program.

## PoC (Steps to reproduce)

  1. Load the invitation token that hackerone mentioned on the summary: https://hackerone.com/invitations/█████.json

  2. Response `{"token":"█████","type":"Invitations::ReportDraft","auth_option":"use-existing-account","email":"████","status":"never","expires_at":null,"team":{"name":"████","handle":"██████","state":"soft_launched","profile_picture":"https://profile-photos.hackerone-user-content.com/production/000/009/583/█████.png?1456279218","url":"https://hackerone.com/██████████"}}`

__Researcher email address:__ ███

__Private program handle name:__ █████████

█████

## Mitigation:

First, immediately remove the token on the summary, second it is good to not display the email address of the researcher on the json response.

Let me know if anything else is needed.

Regards
Japz
vulnerability_information_html:
Hi Team,

Summary:

First, i just want to clarify that this finding seems a purely human mistake from one of the hackerone member team who created a summary of this report: #283309

I have found that you guys (HackerOne) was disclosing email address and private program as part of this report summary of previously disclosed report: https://hackerone.com/reports/283309

Summary screenshot below:

███████

You will observed that HackerOne team create a summary of the report, but the summary discloses the token of the report PoC of the researcher: https://hackerone.com/invitations/%E2%96%88%E2%96%88%E2%96%88%E2%96%88%E2%96%88%E2%96%88%E2%96%88%E2%96%88%E2%96%88.json , but since the token is still valid (means invitation note yet accepted) it discloses the email address of the researcher and the private program.

PoC (Steps to reproduce)

  1. Load the invitation token that hackerone mentioned on the summary: https://hackerone.com/invitations/%E2%96%88%E2%96%88%E2%96%88%E2%96%88%E2%96%88.json

  2. Response {"token":"█████","type":"Invitations::ReportDraft","auth_option":"use-existing-account","email":"████","status":"never","expires_at":null,"team":{"name":"████","handle":"██████","state":"soft_launched","profile_picture":"https://profile-photos.hackerone-user-content.com/production/000/009/583/█████.png?1456279218","url":"https://hackerone.com/██████████"}}

Researcher email address: ███

Private program handle name: █████████

█████

Mitigation:

First, immediately remove the token on the summary, second it is good to not display the email address of the researcher on the json response.

Let me know if anything else is needed.

Regards
Japz

activities.message: The response on the summary was replaced `<censored>` , but without knowing that the token was not yet accepted, therefor loading the url token  https://hackerone.com/invitations/██████████.json will still disclosed all the censored sensitive information (such as email address and private program handle)
activities.markdown_message: The response on the summary was replaced <censored> , but without knowing that the token was not yet accepted, therefor loading the url token https://hackerone.com/invitations/%E2%96%88%E2%96%88%E2%96%88%E2%96%88%E2%96%88%E2%96%88%E2%96%88%E2%96%88%E2%96%88%E2%96%88.json will still disclosed all the censored sensitive information (such as email address and private program handle)

activities.message: I've changed the report so that the token is removed from the summary. We appreciate this but wont be considering this as eligible for a reward. This was a user error that has been remediated. With that said you can feel free to self-close this report. We appreciate you taking the time to report this to us and look forward to more reports from you in the future!

We appreciate you taking the time to report this to us and look forward to more reports from you in the future!

activities.message: Hey @japz as discussed with @reed we will reopen this report to make our decisions making consistent. You have discovered a small information disclosure and we appreciate the heads up.
activities.markdown_message: Hey @japz as discussed with @reed we will reopen this report to make our decisions making consistent. You have discovered a small information disclosure and we appreciate the heads up.

activities.message: As mentioned above, the disclosure is based on human error and the information disclosed is very little. Due to this, we will award you swag for this finding.
activities.markdown_message: As mentioned above, the disclosure is based on human error and the information disclosed is very little. Due to this, we will award you swag for this finding.

activities.message: Sorry for the misunderstanding and inconsistency in our resolving/awarding here, we appreciate you reaching back out and being a great member of our hacking team-thanks again and happy hacking! 🌈
activities.markdown_message: Sorry for the misunderstanding and inconsistency in our resolving/awarding here, we appreciate you reaching back out and being a great member of our hacking team-thanks again and happy hacking! 🌈

activities.message:
Hi @bencode 

>Hey @japz as discussed with @reed we will reopen this report to make our decisions making consistent. You have discovered a small information disclosure and we appreciate the heads up.

Thank you for doing that, actually 7 reputation by closing as `Resolved` is enough for me, but of-course the `swag` is much appreciated.

I'd like to say thank you very much to @reed who response to my email very fast to handle this.

btw @bencode ,

My swag address is old the time you've rewarded the swag almost an hour ago, __I updated my swag address just now__, can you reflect the latest address when sending the swag ?

Regards
Japz

@bencode
